entry.title: Meteor: A better way to build apps
entry.content:
Meteor is “A better way to build apps.” Sounds interesting, but the last time I developed web applications was over 6 years ago, and the notion of “simple” has changed for me significantly.

With that in mind, I checked out one example they have on their website, and it is quite clear that they are really trying to simplify web applications. I want to try it. Is this like a heroku environment and development environment that is fully integrated? Really? More than using Ruby on Rails with the heroku gem?

Here is the help text from the download (done via $ curl http://install.meteor.com | sh):

sh shell code for creating a meteor app $ meteor create ~/my_cool_app $ cd ~/my_cool_app $ meteor Wow!

entry.title: GitHub command line push errors?
entry.content:
If you use Octopress for github pages like every other nerd out there, then you have likely encountered an issue recently: you create a new page and do a rake generate and rake deploy and the username and password don’t seem to work. Specifically, it bombs with a fatal: Authentication failed error.

To fix this problem, see this SO article and this GitHub FAQ.
